title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.3. ENABLING ENVIRONMENT PROTECTION

description.narrative: By end 2021, the government and child protection partners are committed to and capable of legislating, planning and budgeting as regards interventions designed to: prevent or respond to child marriage and FGM/C support a justice system that is responsive to the specific needs of children and birth registration, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice (Covid), Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 6: By the end of 2022, women, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, make greater use of quality public protection services (civil registration service, juvenile justice and social assistance).

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, the government and child protection partners are committed to and capable of legislating, planning and budgeting asregards interventions designed to: prevent or respond to child marriage and FGM/C; support a justice system that is responsive tothe specific needs of children; and birth registration

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support the Government in strengthening the legal and institutional framework for a protective environment for children. The focus was placed on supporting the Government in developing secondary legislation for the acceleration of birth registration and in fulfilling its commitment to report to the Committee on the Rights of the Child on the fulfilment of children’s rights enshrined in the two optional protocols to the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child. Government was able to provide initial reportsand the combined cumulative periodic reports (from the 1st to the 8th) to both optional protocols. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:02/02/2022
